Detailed Description

Author:
Cidana, Inc.
Version:
2.0

Define Documentation

#define CIPL_EVENT_LOOPBACK   0x7ffffff
#define CIPLMGRNOTIFYCALLBACK_DEFINED

The Notify callback is used to return event messages.

One can create the Notify callback prototype and then use RegisterNotify and UnregisterNotify to register and unregister the event callback.

ICiplCtlMgr::RegisterNotify()
ICiplCtlMgr::UnregisterNotify()

This callback is used whenever the Playback Manager receives an event. This should be implemented by the application to service events such as playlist/device changes, etc.

Parameters:
pContextis the same context passed into the manager. Typically pContext is a class instance.
lEventCodeis the raw event code.
pulEventParam1is the first event parameter. The layout is not specified as szEventReturn is used instead.
pulEventParam2is the second event parameter. The layout is not specified as szEventReturn is used instead.
szEventSessionis the session name. This may be NULL.
szEventNameis the event name. For any user servicable event, this is not empty. If the event is for internal debugging purposes, szEventName may be empty and only lEventCode is used.
szEventREturnis the event data or payload. This is a string blob and may be an empty string.

Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* LPFN_CiplMgrConsoleCallback)(IN LPVOID pContext, IN const TCHAR *szString)

The Console callback is used to print any notification strings.

OPTIONAL: One can create the console prototype and then use RegisterConsole and UnregisterConsole to register and unregister the callback.

ICiplCtlMgr::RegisterConsole()
ICiplCtlMgr::UnregisterConsole()

The callback is called whenever a notification message is issued by the Playback Manager. The use of the Console callback is purely for debugging and is informational.

Parameters:
pContextis the same context passed into the manager. Typically pContext is a class instance.
szStringwill be a null terminated string which indicates the notification.
typedef void(* LPFN_CiplMgrNotifyCallback)(IN LPVOID pContext, IN LONG lEventCode, IN ULONG_PTR pulEventParam1, IN ULONG_PTR pulEventParam2, IN const TCHAR *szEventSession, IN const TCHAR *szEventName, IN const TCHAR *szEventReturn)
typedef HRESULT(WINAPI * LPFN_CoCreateCiplManager)(REFCLSID rclsid, LPUNKNOWN pUnkOuter, DWORD dwClsContext, REFIID riid, LPVOID *ppv)

The function type for the COM interface constructor for the Simplified Rev2 Player Control.

The following code fragment shows how to load and obtain the ICiplCtlMgr interface from CiplMgr.dll.

ICiplCtlMgr *mgr = NULL;
HMODULE hLib = LoadLibrary(_T("CiplMgr.dll"));
LPFN_CoCreateCiplManager pCoCreateCiplManager = (LPFN_CoCreateCiplManager) GetProcAddress(hLib,"CoCreateCiplManager");
HRESULT hr = (*pCoCreateCiplManager)(CLSID_CiplCtlMgr,NULL,0,IID_ICiplCtlMgr,(LPVOID *)&mgr);

This is an abbreviated working example. In practice, the return codes should be checked for error. A complete example can be seen in the TestConsole application.

Parameters:
rclsidshould be CLSID_CiplCtlMgr
pUnkOutershould be NULL
dwClsContextshould be 0
riidshould be IID_ICiplCtlMgr
ppvshould be a pointer to the COM ICiplCtlMgr interface pointer.
Returns:
CI_SOK on success.
CI_EFAIL on failure.
CI_EOUTOFMEMORY if storage cannot be allocated.

Enumeration Type Documentation

anonymous enum
Enumerator:
CIPLCTLMGR_OBJECT_TYPE_SESSION 

A session object contains a A/V stream and playback control

CIPLCTLMGR_OBJECT_TYPE_WINDOW 

A window object is usually associated with a session or a video mixer

anonymous enum
Enumerator:
CIPLCTLMGR_OPEN_FLAG_DEVICECOLLECTION_ASYNC 

if set, you should execute "wait devicemanager" before enumerating or using any devices.
